column4: I can't log into my gnome desktop. All the bars are gone. Alt+F2 doesn't work. Removing and reinstalling gnome doesn't work. This is the 3rd time it's happened to me on 3 seperate installations. What the **** is going on, besides GNOME being the biggest piece of rubbish ever?
Even Windows doesn't have stupid bugs like that, armornick
So, any idea how I can fix it?
Linux is a cult
I'm in KDE now
But that's not the point
You can't advertise Ubuntu as a "solid" OS when even its default GUI is riddled with bugs
I AM asking for help
How do I fix it?
a bug for you isnt `riddled` .. Ive used ubuntu since 5.10.  no issues
explain your problem and wait.
we dont work for you, just state the issue, and while you wait, go google
have you tried disabling compiz? like try to ctrl-alt-F1, and do metacity --replace
have you tried earlier versions at all?
karmic isnt the be-all end-all
yes, I've been using Ubuntu on and off since Hardy
bar icons switched?  like, if you dont `lock` them?
I tried locking; does f-all
wow, and its still not working for you?  thats a first.
it did it way back in Hardy days too
dont know then, Ive installed it for a lot of people and there have been issues, but resolved issues..
does a livecd boot ok even ?
